body:
I made this patch which is working for me. Anyway, I can't tell if it's archetonically appropriate.
[grpc1.15.1-crash-in-weighted_target.patch](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/files/10843763/grpc1.15.1-crash-in-weighted_target.patch)
I would be wonderful to get fix into a 1.51.x branch. This version is now in next stable Debian (bookworm).

I don't understand how this could happen.  I think it should be impossible for `tf_picker_list` to be empty at that point, because if there are no children in state READY, IDLE, or CONNECTING, there must be at least one in state TRANSIENT_FAILURE.

Note that it's not possible that there are no children at all here, because in that case, [we will immediately return a `TransientFailurePicker`](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/1548038a09a95c3a00ec92b67a404cf3aacec489/src/core/ext/filters/client_channel/lb_policy/weighted_target/weighted_target.cc#L356) without calling `UpdateStateLocked()`.  Also, the trace log you pasted shows that there is actually a child in state TRANSIENT_FAILURE here:

```
I0227 16:36:12.955613250      37 weighted_target.cc:387]               [weighted_target_lb 0x7fb3e03c52c0] scanning children to determine connectivity state
I0227 16:36:12.955618608      37 weighted_target.cc:413]               [weighted_target_lb 0x7fb3e03c52c0]   child={region="", zone="unk", sub_zone=""} state=TRANSIENT_FAILURE weight=100 picker=0x7fb3e03c8550
I0227 16:36:12.955625855      37 weighted_target.cc:456]               [weighted_target_lb 0x7fb3e03c52c0] connectivity changed to TRANSIENT_FAILURE
```

Also, note that we do actually have a test that covers the case of a single locality with no endpoints, and it does not show a crash:

https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/1548038a09a95c3a00ec92b67a404cf3aacec489/test/cpp/end2end/xds/xds_cluster_end2end_test.cc#L436

Given that this test is passing, I'm not sure how to reproduce this problem.  Can you send me a full log of the client with all of the following tracers enabled?

`GRPC_TRACE=xds_client,xds_resolver,xds_cluster_manager_lb,cds_lb,xds_cluster_resolver_lb,priority_lb,xds_cluster_impl_lb,weighted_target_lb`

Thanks!

I made simple app using only one gRPC server to connect. I used tag `1.51.1`.

1) booted up when the gRPC server have one replica
2) the app started to send requests
3) deleted pod with the gRPC server
4) the app receive update

I thing that problem is that the locality have endpoint and then receive update where is no endpoint.

We have own xds server, but it should not be matter.
[unpatched.version.txt](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/files/10925435/unpatched.version.txt)
[patched.version.txt](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/files/10925437/patched.version.txt)

issue.title: xDS: fix crash when removing the last endpoint from the last locality in weighted_target

labels.name: release notes: no
labels.description: Indicates if PR should not be in release notes

labels.name: imported
labels.description: Specifies if the PR has been imported to the internal repository

repository.name: grpc
repository.description: C++ based gRPC (C++, Python, Ruby, Objective-C, PHP, C#)

body:
I still can't reproduce this problem.  I've written a test in https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/32571 that covers this exact scenario, and it does not crash.  I even ran the test with 1.51.1 and it passed.

I think we need to try to figure out what the important differences are between what this test is doing and what you are doing.  Can you share your simple app code with me so that I can compare the two?  Are you doing anything in the app that might affect the behavior, such as setting any channel args?

I just spotted something in the unpatched log that might explain what's happening here.  It looks like *after* the weighted_target policy sees the empty update and deactivates its child policy, we then get a connectivity state update from the deactivated child, which is what triggers `UpdateStateLocked()`.  I think that's what's causing the crash -- we should really be ignoring that update.

I'm going to try to write a test that exercises this case and then put together a fix.
Yup, that was the problem.  I've updated #32571 to reproduce the bug in a test and fix it.

I can confirm that it resolve the issue.

The app is stable. The error give to by failed request is good `no children in weighted_target policy: EDS resource dummy-server-cluster contains empty localities: [{region="", zone="unk", sub_zone=""}]`. After k8s started pod again, the app has recovered an connection.

As as stated before, would be great to have it backported. The version 1.51.x is part of nex stable debian.
I'm back-porting the fix to 1.51 in #32594 and 1.52 in #32593.
